UnitType.Backstory:
The Shadowed Sepulcher started as a low, swampy field around a sharp edged stone nearly the size of a wagon. Nothing grew in the field and the ground was too soft to support building so the people of Millis Mor made it into their graveyard. Animals avoid the area and it was quiet, somber and unsettling. The land was so soft that grave markers disappeared into the ground within a few years of being placed.
Some complained that the dismal field is no place for the honored dead. But more valuable land was claimed for new farms, homes or markets in the growing village. Because the grave markers disappeared into the ground old sections of the field would open up for a new generation of memories, tears and bodies.
Until that autumn night when the resurrection failed. Many speculated that only those that were troubled or cruel in life rose. But it was the lingering spirits of demons that animated them. And that great twisted stone at the center of the Shadowed Sepulcher was a death shard, a prison of corrupted magic and whispering demons. The demons called to the dead of Millis Mor, to the dead of villages past that had been built at that site, and those that had been sacrificed there long ago when the site was a temple to the cult of a hundred eyes.
And the dead poured out of the soft ground. Together they swept into Millis Mor, captured every citizen and dragged them back to the Shadowed Sepulcher and buried them alive and screaming in the soft ground.
Now the village lies empty and inviting. There is no sign or trouble, only empty buildings and overgrown fields that could be repaired with little work. And any who resettled the village would find it a good home for most of the year. Until that autumn night came again, and the demons called for the dead to bring their sacrifice. In the morning the village would be empty again, and another generation of bodies would be added to the Shadowed Sepulcher.

UnitType.Description: The disembodied spirit of someone who was murdered in cold blood. Blinded by hatred and jealousy for those still living, and enslaved by the dark magic of necromancy.

UnitType.Description: Remains of those long dead, called back to service by necromancers.
